column2: As a Project Manager in the technology industry, specifically in software development using Agile methodology, you will play a crucial role in overseeing the successful execution of software development projects        Leveraging your 2+ years of experience as a software developer and 5+ years of project management experience, you will lead cross-functional teams, ensuring the timely delivery of high-quality software solutions      Your expertise in Agile methodologies and technical background will be essential in driving efficiency, collaboration, and innovation within the software development life cycle (SDLC)                Responsibilities:                Project Planning and Execution:                Collaborate with stakeholders to define project scope, goals, and deliverables.              Develop and maintain project plans, including tasks, timelines, and resource allocation.              Coordinate and lead Agile ceremonies, such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.              Monitor project progress, identify potential risks, and proactively address issues to ensure project milestones are achieved.                Team Collaboration and Leadership:                Foster a collaborative and high-performing team environment.              Facilitate effective communication and collaboration among team members, stakeholders, and clients.              Provide guidance and support to team members in adopting and adhering to Agile practices.              Empower team members to make decisions and take ownership of their work.                Requirements Management:                Work closely with stakeholders to gather and prioritize project requirements.              Ensure requirements are well-defined, documented, and understood by the development team.              Facilitate requirements refinement sessions and manage changes throughout the project.                Resource Management:                Identify resource needs and collaborate with resource managers to ensure adequate staffing.              Allocate resources efficiently and optimize team productivity.              Monitor and manage project budgets, ensuring projects are delivered within allocated resources.                Risk Management:                Identify, assess, and mitigate project risks.              Develop risk mitigation strategies and contingency plans.              Communicate project risks to stakeholders and implement risk response actions as needed.                Quality Assurance:                Collaborate with the quality assurance team to define and implement quality standards and processes.              Ensure rigorous testing and quality control throughout the software development life cycle.              Monitor and evaluate project deliverables to ensure compliance with quality standards.                Stakeholder Management:                Engage and communicate effectively with stakeholders, keeping them informed of project progress, risks, and changes.              Manage stakeholder expectations and address any concerns or conflicts that may arise.                  Requirements:                  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.              Minimum of 2+ years of experience as a software developer.              Minimum of 5+ years of project management experience.              Strong knowledge of Agile methodologies, such as Scrum or Kanban.              In-depth understanding of the software development life cycle (SDLC) and its various phases.              Excellent leadership and team management skills.              Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.              Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.              Proficient in project management tools and software.              Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.

ERP experience would be an added advantage.                              Ability to prioritize projects and activities to ensure completion of projects on time and within budget.                              Familiar with Project Management tools.                              Excellent English skills, verbal and written.                              Be able to work in a Global Customer facing role.                              Passion and aptitude to learn new skills and be able to work productively and efficiently.                              Ability and desire to adapt to a fast-paced environment with changing customer needs, technology requirements and strategic direction with ease.                                  What We Offer:                                  A positive, open, and highly-innovative environment and team                              Entrepreneurial spirit with unlimited opportunity to grow                              Opportunity to work with leading global brands on exciting and impactful projects                              Competitive Base Pay                              Best of plan on Vacation & Paid Time Off. column2: As a Project Manager in the pharmaceutical industry with a PhD (Doctor of Philosophy), your role involves overseeing and managing projects related to drug development, clinical trials, regulatory compliance, or other pharmaceutical initiatives     Your advanced academic background in pharmaceutical sciences provides you with a deep understanding of the industry and scientific principles     You develop project plans, timelines, and budgets, considering the specific objectives, deliverables, and resource requirements of pharmaceutical projects     You coordinate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to ensure effective project execution     Risk Assessment and Management: You identify potential risks and challenges associated with the project and develop risk management strategies to mitigate them     This includes monitoring and evaluating risks throughout the project lifecycle and implementing contingency plans when necessary     Regulatory Compliance: You ensure that projects comply with relevant pharmaceutical regulations, guidelines, and quality standards     This may involve coordinating with regulatory affairs teams to obtain necessary approvals, managing documentation for regulatory submissions, and ensuring adherence to Good Clinical Practice (GCP) or Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) guidelines     ?

column2: As the Manager - Agroforestry and Watershed, you will play a crucial role in advancing BharatCares mission to promote sustainable land management practices through agroforestry and watershed development. Working closely with farmers, communities, and stakeholders, you will provide technical expertise, project management support, and capacity building to drive positive change in Telangana s agricultural landscape.         ?       Responsibilities             On-ground Execution: Lead execution in the design, development, and end to end implementation of agroforestry and watershed management projects.                 Technical Expertise: Provide technical guidance to farmers and communities on agroforestry practices, including tree selection, planting techniques, and integration with crops.                 Watershed Management: Contribute to watershed development projects by conducting surveys, preparing technical and financial plans, and implementing soil and water conservation measures.                 Project Management: Be extensively involved in the planning, implementation, and monitoring of agroforestry and watershed development projects to ensure successful outcomes.                 Capacity Building: Conduct training workshops and demonstrations for farmers and communities on agroforestry and watershed management practices to enhance their knowledge and skills.                 Monitoring and Evaluation: Collect data, monitor project progress, and prepare reports to assess the impact of our initiatives and inform future interventions.                 Collaboration: Work effectively with government agencies, NGOs, and other stakeholders to promote agroforestry and watershed management initiatives and foster collaboration for greater impact.             Mandatory Qualification and Experience:             Bachelors degree in Agriculture, Environmental Science or related field; Masters degree preferred.                 Minimum 5 years of progressive experience in designing, managing, and implementing agricultural development programs, with a strong focus on sustainable or regenerative agriculture and watershed management.                 Deep understanding of regenerative agriculture principles and practices, with proven experience applying them in the Indian context.                 Demonstrated expertise in research, data analysis, and program evaluation, with a track record of producing high-quality reports and recommendations.                 Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills, with the ability to build and maintain effective relationships with diverse stakeholders.                 Strong leadership qualities, with the ability to inspire, motivate, and mentor team members towards achieving shared goals.                 Fluency in English and Telugu required; proficiency in local languages of target regions preferred.                 Benefits:                 Opportunity to drive positive change and make a tangible impact on farmers livelihoods and environmental sustainability.                 Stimulating and dynamic work environment with opportunities for professional growth and development.                 Competitive salary and benefits package commensurate with experience and qualifications.                 Joining a passionate and purpose-driven team committed to fostering diversity, equity, and inclusion.
column11: Project development, Data analysis, Environmental science, CSR, Project management, Pharma, Diversity and Inclusion, Design development, Manager Technology, Housing finance

column2: Role & responsibilities   1. Person should be able to understand and has expertise the commercial, legal terms and conditions of contract and monitoring the same throughout the contract period. 2. This position should have experience of "Project Management" in addition to "Contract Management" experience and should have at least executed few Projects independently as Project Manager on behalf of EPC (Engineering Procurement and Construction) Company. 3. This position should also get involved during bidding/tendering stage itself, guide the "respective marketing team" for deviation/comments on the legal/Commercial terms of tender document, make marketing team to understand the liabilities company will have, if accept those terms of tender. 4. Person should work closely with "respective Project Manager" as a team and guide them time to time throughout the time period of contract of client for legal and commercial terms and conditions. 5. During order execution, guide Project Manager to ensure writing letters to client, time to time, either through Project Manager or directly to client (as decided) with proper contractual wording, (thus should have good communication skills in writing letters contractually) right from 1st day of contract till contract execution, to ensure and take care in future, for a. Delivery extension of project b. Price amendment if any against extra claim. c. To safeguard company against any legal/commercial/financial liabilities etc. 6. This position also gets involved while discussing with client to ensure no legal liabilities/additional expenses or commercial terms are passed on us. 7. As and when required, join along with respective marketing team as well as Project Managers to discuss with client for the clarification/explanation of deviation/comments etc. against legal, commercial terms and condition of tender/contract documents of client. 8. This position should also guide, Purchase Dept for finalizing all commercial and legal terms and conditions of purchase order being released for bought out equipment/Material etc. of the respective projects. 9. This position also should have past experience of handling arbitration/legal cases against contract of client (with support from Advocate etc.) and also should have fairly good knowledge of judiciary procedure of India for handling legal cases. They should have fairly good experience in appointing right advocate for Company in case of legal dispute with client. Preferred candidate profile   Candidate should have experience in project mgmt. Commercial contract mgmt. Commercial & legal from commercial perspective risk identification, Contract Law, Legal Notices, large contract. BG, Advances, Commercial & Contract obligation, Contract Management needs to work along with Project Manager.  Perks and benefits

column2: We are seeking an experienced and skilled Project Manager to oversee our projects in the West Region, encompassing the states of Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh and Goa. The ideal candidate should possess a minimum of 10 years of relevant experience and be well-versed in Intelligent Building Management Systems (iBMS) and various Extra-Low Voltage (ELV) systems such as Fire, Public Address (PA), Access Control (ACS) and CCTV for Building Automation.           Key Responsibilities:           To execute projects within the defined requirements (e.g. regarding targets for project cost, time, quality, functionality and customer satisfaction) with close coordination across multiple functions including engineering, business controlling, supply chain management, logistics as well as interfaces with other project management offices as key internal stake holders. To possess strong leadership abilities to effectively manage and motivate the project team. Foster a collaborative and positive work environment to achieve project goals.     ?     Be responsible to drive the project according to areas of project management within (PM@Siemens) Project Excellence Guidelines including preparing detailed project management plans, resources allocation, conduct monthly project reviews and reporting project health status, controlling NCCs, preparing / updating project risk register and derive mitigation measures, timely preparation of claims and ensure claim management, material handling and related logistics, and finally achieving execution excellence including higher customer satisfaction.     ?     To prepare purchase requisition with detailed scope of work for contractors and support supply chain management during negotiations.     To possess strong analytical/problem solving skills and negotiation skills for effective handling of Risk and Opportunity as well as Claim Management leading to overall project success and customer satisfaction.     To consider travelling as an integral part of the job and ready to travel frequently for short to medium duration to sites for customer meetings during project execution.     ?     To create new business opportunities while executing projects.     To adhere to highest safety standards and exhibit process-oriented approach.     To have knowhow of full profit and loss responsibility in managing projects in ELV & iBMS segments. Previous work experience with domain knowhow in these verticals shall have an added advantage.     To have experience in handling complex projects involving multi-cultural, multi-national, multi-regional, diverse group of project team members and stake holders as well as understanding topics related to taxation, cross-border staffing and contract management very well.     To be able to carry out Electrical project procurement activities as EPC Contractor.     To do meetings with client / consultant for their queries, issues during execution stage.     To prepare of purchase requisition with Tech. Specification of various ELV Equipment s.     To have knowhow & understanding of iBMS and ELV systems, providing technical guidance and solutions as required during project execution.     To have knowhow & understanding of Installation & Commissioning of equipment s in ELV & iBMS systems     ?     Financial Management: Assume responsibility for monthly turnover planning and cash collection for projects under your purview. Reporting: Report regularly to the Territory Manager, providing updates on project status, risks, and mitigation strategies.     Multi-Project Handling: Manage multiple projects concurrently, ensuring efficient resource allocation and timely project completion.     EHS & quality Focus: Demonstrate sensitivity towards Environment, Health, and Safety (EHS) regulations, enforcing strict compliance at project sites. Ensuring Quality work at sites.            Qualifications and Skills:           - BE/BTech/Diploma - Electrical / Electronics / Industrial Electronics Engineering     - Valid PM Certification (Cat C or S Project as per PM @ Siemens as a pre-requisite for this position will be an added advantage).     - Minimum 10 years of relevant experience in Project Management in the Building Automation industry.     - Strong knowledge of iBMS and ELV systems (Fire, PA, CCTV, ACS).     - Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.     - Proven ability to handle and lead a team effectively.     - Sound project management skills, including planning, execution, and risk management.     - Willingness to travel extensively within the region as required.     - Ability to work independently and take ownership of project deliverables.     - Adept at financial planning and project budget management.     - Demonstrated commitment to EHS practices.

column2: Role & responsibilities   Project Planning and Scheduling: Assist project managers in developing project plans, schedules, and timelines for environmental consulting and zero waste projects. Coordinate with internal teams and external stakeholders to allocate resources, set milestones, and establish project objectives and deliverables. Documentation   and Reporting: Maintain accurate project documentation,   including project plans, meeting minutes, progress reports, and budget   updates. Prepare and distribute project status reports to stakeholders,   highlighting key milestones, accomplishments, and potential risks or issues.    Team Coordination: Coordinate activities and tasks among internal project teams, including environmental consultants, engineers, technicians, and subcontractors. Facilitate effective communication and collaboration to ensure that project objectives are met and deliverables are produced according to quality standards and timelines. Budget Monitoring and Cost Control: Assist project managers in monitoring project budgets, expenses, and resource allocations. Track project costs, review financial reports, and identify opportunities to optimize project efficiency and minimize costs while adhering to budget constraints. Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with stakeholders, including government agencies, regulatory bodies, community organizations, and industry partners, to foster collaboration, address concerns, and facilitate project approvals and permits as needed.   Preferred candidate profile   A bachelor's degree in environmental science, environmental engineering, sustainability, project management, business administration, or a related field is required. A degree with a focus on environmental studies or project management provides a solid foundation for understanding the complexities of environmental projects. Previous experience in project coordination, project management support, or related roles is highly desirable. Experience working on environmental projects or within the environmental consulting industry is particularly advantageous. Demonstrated ability to coordinate activities and tasks among multidisciplinary project teams, including environmental consultants, engineers, scientists, and subcontractors. Experience fostering collaboration, facilitating communication, and resolving conflicts within project teams is beneficial. Experience in monitoring project budgets, tracking expenses, and allocating resources effectively. Familiarity with financial reporting, budget analysis, and cost control measures to ensure projects remain within budgetary constraints. Understanding of environmental regulations, permitting requirements, and compliance standards relevant to the projects being undertaken.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify project risks, issues, and dependencies, and develop appropriate mitigation strategies and contingency plans. Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. column2: The Project Management area is responsible for leading a team, typically cross-functional teams, to achieve project goals and requirements.      Work with project teams and stakeholders to plan, execute, monitor, and control the project. Manage resources, budget, cost, time, quality, risks and other constraints.            Responsibilities              Position Summary:          The Global Service Delivery Project Management team is to provide a professional project management service supporting the Global Service Delivery and Processing Operations organisations for the delivery of projects within the Payment, Financial and Telecoms divisions.      The Project Manager will manage projects requiring provision and implementation of services. These projects are derived from two sources, customers and internally. The Project Manager is expected to manage multiple concurrent projects and to have full control of those projects during their entire lifecycle. The Project Manager will work with guidance and supervision from the management team.      Projects range in size from a week to many months. In most cases the Project Manager will be heavily reliant on specialist teams to deliver their work, therefore people management is key. This does not rule out the possibility, on occasions, of Project Managers having technical input and ownership where their skills suit.      The Project Manager has the authority to run the project on a day-to-day basis on behalf of the Project Sponsors within the constraints laid down by them. Prime responsibility is to ensure that the project produces the required deliverables, to the required standard of quality and within the specified constraints of time and cost.      Whilst a managed and structured approach to Project Management is required, this should not be a limiting FRctor. The Project Manager, with the support of the Management team must be capable of selecting the appropriate project controls on a per project basis bearing in mind the FRst paced environment we operate within.          Primary Duties and Responsibilities:          Manage the delivery of the required objectives within agreed time and budget parameters.      Direct and motivate the overall project team.      Produce all relevant documentation in line with the departmental procedures; this may include the participation in external audits.      Provide regular project status reports.      Identify and recommend operational improvement opportunities consistent with the delivery of the key project outputs (NB any such opportunity must be carefully scrutinised to assess that it is IN/OUT of project scope).      Prepare, track, and maintain the project plan throughout the project lifecycle.      Monitor resource availability and utilisation.      Establish all required communication paths and processes within the project and between the project and other interested parties in the business, and with customers and 3rd parties.      Identify, via a risk log, and manage business and project risks, including the development of contingency plans via the nominated risk owners.      Formally manage issues through to resolution and utilise the escalation path where necessary.      Correct implementation of the change control process.      Responsible for managing the internal and external dependencies that may influence the project.      Liaise, closely, with the project sponsors to assure the overall direction and integrity of the project      Agree technical and quality strategy with appropriate members of the project team.      Prepare any follow-on action recommendations required at the end of project      Identify and obtain support and advice required for project management, planning or control      Be responsible for project administration.      Liaise with any Suppliers and account managers.      Assist, as required, with the management of standard work requests.      Maintain professional standards by keeping abreast of the latest trends and techniques.      Maintain an understanding of the technologies and products within TNS.      Qualifications:      Working with others - as part of a team, as opposed to working separately or competitively.      Organising work/project management - the ability to establish a clearly defined course of action to accomplish goals and to organise work efforts.      Technical /professional expertise - the ability and motivation to expand ones own technical/professional knowledge and share this experience.      Customer orientation - a willingness to help and serve others and meet their needs whether they are internal or external.      Change management/adaptability - the ability to maintain effectiveness in a challenging environment.      Directing work through others - the ability to direct, when necessary, the activities of others in the best interests of the organisation and its customers.      Computer literate with sound working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Project, Visio, Sharepoint.      Competent in report and project documentation writing.      Worked as a Project Manager for at least two years within the technology (Telecommunications environment particularly) sectors.      Strong technical IT industry experience in one or more of the following; Network/communications, Processing, card payments, EFT or application development.      Well practised at conducting workshops and meetings.                      Qualifications              Desired Qualifications:          5+ years as a project manager in IT or FinTech Industry only.      Personal drive - the drive to work well and achieve results by competing against a standard of excellence.      Initiative - a bias for action to meet immediate challenges or to think ahead and meet future opportunities and challenges      Building trust - the ability to stick with principles that both earn and foster trust and respect from others      Influence - the ability to persuade or influence other people to accept a point of view, to adopt a specific agenda or take a course of action      Analysis - the ability to gather relevant information, notice relationships between different pieces of information, reason from cause to effect and generate effective solutions to practical problems      Self confidence - a belief in ones own opinion, decision and capability to accomplish a task and select an effective approach to a task or problem          Education and Certifications:          Formal Project Methodology training e.g. PRINCE2, PMP      Degree/HNC in a technically related discipline (IT, Telecommunications)

column2: We are seeking a talented and experienced Greenfield HVAC projects Manager to join our team. As a company that specializes in the design, installation, and commissioning of HVAC systems in new buildings and facilities, we are looking for a candidate who can take responsibility in managing and executing complex greenfield projects. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in HVAC system design, project management, project Execution, project planning, regulatory compliance, quality control, and client communication, vendor management, managing the high and low side, mainly into residential and commercial buildings.    Responsibilities Responsibilities      Support in creating BOQs & taking quotations for site execution works from multiple contractors, which fit within the SJPL s execution standards criteria     Coordinating with the Procurement team for evaluation of service partners which are involved in or proposed for project execution at the site.     Relationship Management      Clients: Coordinating with the client s representatives to facilitate support during project execution works for system installation and BMS deployment      Holding regular meetings with customer representatives along with site-PM and understanding if Client is facing any problems or have any suggestions for improvement.     Service partners and Subcontractors: Maintaining good relationships with high quality, reliable and cost-effective service partners and contractors to ensure smooth functioning of works at site.     Execution      Executing all tasks related to site execution as instructed by the PM of their respective site/region to achieve target completion timelines      Service partner and subcontractor coordination for site related activities      Taking necessary steps for achieving weekly and monthly completion targets for all ECMs and taking course corrective actions wherever necessary to avoid delays      To execute projects with the objective of handing over ECM-Wise Snag-Free Projects to Operations Team     Recording all site-related expenses including ad-hoc cash expenses, as and when incurred     Ensuring proper branding is maintained and all spaces around Smart Joules equipment are neat and tidy.         Support in validating savings for each of the ECMs post commissioning using audit instruments, and based on methodology defined by Central Design team      Preparing and sharing necessary documents, as instructed, to your respective PMs for compiling a detailed project handover report to the Operations team.      Skills & Experience Required Experience      8-10+ years of experience covering a mix of project execution (preferably in HVAC and electrical utilities) experience, Service partner management & handling site execution, project execution and planning of the entire project.      Should have handled execution of 4-5 HVAC projects as project engineer     Knowledge and experience with service partner management & manpower management at site, for getting the works executed within timelines     Knowledge and experience with site engineering related concepts such as water piping, valves, pumping systems, electrical supply systems etc.     Strong computer skills (Web Search, Email, Word, Excel, Power Point)     Communication: Must speak English and Hindi, and the local language spoken in their region. Must be able to make effective presentations to a variety of audiences.     Knowledge of mass balance and heat balance, and other energy calculations     Knowledgeable about products, services, companies and people involved in HVAC high side system supply & installations     Knowledgeable about leading quality standards (ISO, ISHRAE, BEE) and certifications (LEED, NABH).     The candidate should have experience in managing projects from concept to completion or Greenfield Projects     B. Tech in Mechanical Engineering/ Electrical also preferred. The role is Manager and the person has to travel to various sites, so should be open for that. Skills & Behaviour      Fitment to SJPL Core Values     Communication: Must communicate effectively with variety of Stakeholders and customers     Courage to roll with the punches and keep going at it.     Pays major attention to minor details     Tenacity, reliability, perseverance, pursuit of quality. Be able to prioritize their own work, and focus on executing a particular task/project to completion under the pressure     Ability to multitask - Quickly understand the requirements of diverse stakeholders
column11: Procurement, Relationship management, HVAC, ISO, Project management, Valves, System design, Project planning, Budgeting, Operations

column2: You will be responsible for planning, tracking and executing digital design and software development projects for clients ranging from small startups to large multinational customers. From understanding the requirements, creating plans, allocating resources, ensuring the timely completion of projects, the Project Manager will be the go-to person for clients through the life cycle of the project.     Your Mission           Liaise with clients and other stakeholders involved to determine and document the Scope of the project.             Plan and execute project objectives by defining the scope and ensure on-time delivery within the set budget.             Track project plans to ensure milestones are met on a consistent basis.             Work closely with the client POC / Project Manager, clients and the internal project team ensuring effective exchange of information so that the project is delivered on time and within budget.             Define weekly tasks and resource requirements and manage designers/developers schedule for utilisation.             Draft proposals for existing clients (addendum or additional scope) and new clients (RFP s).             Work closely with the management team to improve existing processes. Provide support to Business Development efforts and build long term relationships with both new and existing clients.             Communicate project status with management, team members and other stakeholders on an ongoing basis. Manage changes to the scope, schedule, costs, and timelines for the project.             Manage feedback, inputs and approval flows for design and development reviews.             Be responsible for reporting to the management of the health and profitability of the project.         Superpowers You Will Need           Excellent oral and written communication skills             3+ years of experience in Project Management or Client Servicing             Prior Project Management experience or recent certification             Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word and Powerpoint             Ability to organise and maintain file structures for project deliverables             Ability to identify a problem, execute a solution, and escalate if necessary             Be any graduate             Be a People s person and an effective communicator
column11: Manager Client Servicing, Excel, Digital design, Business design, Project management, Design management, Design development, Budgeting, Management, RFP

column2: Lead the planning, execution, and monitoring of skill development and capacity building projects from inception to completion.                 Ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the required quality standards.                 Supervise and manage project staff, including trainers, coordinators, and administrative personnel.                 Provide leadership, guidance, and support to ensure project team members perform effectively and meet project goals.                 Explore and establish partnerships with stakeholders, including government agencies, educational institutions, industry partners, and community organizations.                 Collaborate with stakeholders to identify training needs, develop training programs, and ensure alignment with project objectives     .                 Work closely with subject matter experts to design, develop, and update training curricula and learning materials.                 Ensure training programs are relevant, engaging, and aligned with industry standards and best practices.               Monitoring and Evaluation:               Develop and implement monitoring and evaluation frameworks to assess the effectiveness and impact of training programs.                 Collect and analyze data to measure outcomes, identify areas for improvement, and make evidence-based decisions.                 Prepare project budgets and monitor expenditures to ensure funds are utilized efficiently and in accordance with donor requirements.                 Identify opportunities for cost savings and revenue generation to maximize project resources.                 Prepare regular progress reports, financial reports, and other documentation as required by project stakeholders and donors.                 Communicate project updates, achievements, and challenges effectively to internal and external audiences.                 Identify and mitigate project risks, ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and standards.             Reporting and Coordination:              You will report to Senior Manager/Assistant Programme Director in DAHQ.                  Coordinate with the corporate Communication and Knowledge Management unit for outcome and impact data collection, collation, and analysis.                Coordinate all administrative issues with respective departments.

column2: Building on our past.Ready for the future           Worley is a global professional services company of energy, chemicals and resources experts.  We partner with customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their assets.  We re bridging two worlds, moving towards more sustainable energy sources, while helping to provide the energy, chemicals and resources needed now. Designation:    Engineering ManagerBusiness         Development Support Assists business development activities by facilitating the maintenance of personal profiles and resumes, tracking existing capabilities, and strategically addressing future customer capability requirements.  Encourages positive working relationships with external parties such as the customer, suppliers, and contractors.  May be involved in networking, negotiations, strategic alliancing, and cost savings efforts.  Stewards the maintenance of pricing records reflecting the effort to complete discipline activities.  May support proposals by developing the engineering execution strategy, reviewing costs, writing proposal content, and presenting to customers.  May be called upon to lead part or all of a proposal. Business Operations    Participates in budgeting and manage engineering operations to the budget.  Controls engineering staffing levels, organizational structure, and monitors project discipline structures.  Administers engineering software licensing and costs.  Creates and maintains engineering guidelines.  Ensures mentoring/training requirements are met.  Manages the employee performance review process.  Facilitates coverage of activities when people leave the team.  Contributes to dispute resolution efforts.  Ensures cross-discipline technical work and team activities meet all health, safety, environmental, and security requirements.  Technical Competency    Owns engineering technical competency and quality programs and oversees technical competency of those within the location.  Ensures team member adherence to company processes, generally accepted engineering and design practices, regulatory requirements, and customer specifications.  Supports global standardization of equipment specifications, drawings, and document templates and oversees use by the team.  Assures the understanding of technical knowledge, legal requirements, and customer specifications whenever viable and lawful.  Uses local/global standards to support technical excellence.  Stewards discipline checking and technical peer reviews. Project Execution    Facilitates meeting project requirements through the use of engineering guidelines, programs, and management of the resources allocated to projects.  May participate in project execution strategy and planning.  Drives innovative solutions, technology advances, and methods to effectively deal with working out of sequence.  May work with Project Management Teams to take corrective actions regarding any issues, staffing requirements, scope changes, progressing, or other events that could affect project completion and/or profitability.  Reviews and authorizes work done by Discipline Managers. HSE Capability Assume hands-on management and implementation of all relevant company HSE requirements.  Drive Safe and Sustainable engineering outcomes throughout the asset lifecycle via the application of SEAL.  Role-model a commitment to personal well-being and a pro-active approach to continuously improving health, safety and environmental performance. People Skills Interpersonal: Builds appropriate, constructive, and effective business.                                 Qualifications, Accreditation, Training (Essential)      Trained in leadership and project execution. Will be actively licensed with a local engineering governing body where required by law.           Qualifications, Accreditation, Training           (Desirable)      Training in risk management or quality.           Job Specific Knowledge            Experience (Essential) Has a strong understanding of cross-discipline work, interfaces, and sequencing. Well versed in engineering governance, project execution, and fiscal management. Skilled in estimating project costs and writing proposal content. Adept at budgeting and cost control.          Job Specific         Knowledge /         Experience (Desirable) Experience in project management, risk management, quality, procurement, or construction execution.           Decision Making      Make engineering management decisions under the general direction of the Location Manager. Manages cross-discipline resource mobilization and demobilization to maintain sufficient resourcing and ensure cost effectiveness. Accountable for the performance of the team, discipline risks, and driving continuous improvement. Responsible for discipline planning, budgeting, and approval of expenditures. Implements approved discipline programs in accordance with budget and company policy.         Supervision Authority Discipline Managers in the location.         Communication Effectively communicate and present complex proposals and reports to senior level management. Ability to persuade and influence others. Participative management style with a cooperative team approach.                   Systems & Tools         (Essential) Competent in Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, Teams, and PowerPoint. Can organize information from many sources and retain as per the prescribed format and policies. Has functional awareness of cross-discipline tools. Experienced in coordinating the establishment/use of integrated tools and delivering the benefits of data centric engineering.         Systems & Tools         (Desirable) Competent in Microsoft Access and Visio. Able to touch type.         relationships throughout the organization; uses diplomacy and tact; is approachable; communicates clearly, accurately, and consistently both verbally and in written matters. Employs the principles of active listening and encourages feedback from others. Teamwork: Enjoys working in a small high caliber team with high visibility to senior stakeholders. Able to work and liaise with multiple teams and stakeholders, able to prioritise workloads and help other team members to achieve team goals. Action Orientation: Achieves results set by self and others, meets timelines, pushes to achieve stretch goals, and demonstrates enthusiasm, persistence and tenacity. Breaks down work into executable tasks. Acts accountable for work produced and ensures it is "right the first time.  Intellectual Capacity: Deals with new concepts and complexity comfortably. Examines problems carefully and thoroughly and understands their interdependencies. Can pull information and ideas from many sources and see the importance of many factors.                         Moving forward together         We re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and respectful workplace where everyone feels they belong, can bring themselves, and are heard. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by law.       We want our people to be energized and empowered to drive sustainable impact. So, our focus is on a values-inspired culture that unlocks brilliance through belonging, connection, and innovation.       And were not just talking about it; were doing it. Were reskilling our people, leveraging transferable skills, and supporting the transition of our workforce to become experts in todays low carbon energy infrastructure and technology.       Whatever your ambition, there s a path for you here. And there s no barrier to your potential career success. Join us to broaden your horizons, explore diverse opportunities, and be part of delivering sustainable change.

column2: The Project Engineering Manager will join the Engineering Management practice within the Technical Professional Organization (TPO) of Engineering Services Canada. The Project Engineering Manager will play a lead role in the delivery of Engineering Services on large and complex projects.     Reporting to the VP and Practice Lead, Engineering Management Practice, the Project Engineering Manager will contribute to the development of the project engineering strategy and directly lead the all or portions of large, multi-disciplinary projects and/or scopes of work from inception to completion. In addition, the Engineering Manager will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including project managers, designers, stakeholders to deliver high-quality solutions that meet and exceed client expectations. The ideal candidate will possess strong communication skills, technical expertise, hold a Professional Engineering credential and have at least 5 years leading multidisciplinary coordination of large engineering projects.       Responsibilities         Project Planning and Execution:         Collaborate with project managers to define engineering objectives, delivery schedules, and deliverables, ensuring alignment with client and project requirements and overall business objectives.     Oversee the delivery of the engineering project, including design, development, testing, and implementation, while coordinating resources effectively.     Ensure all deliverables and obligations associated with the scope of work are fully understood and identified.     Prepare and coordinate work hour estimates for the project and ensure respect of project budget and schedule.     Monitor project progress, identify and mitigate risks, and resolve any issues or bottlenecks that may impact project timelines or quality.         Technical Expertise and Quality Assurance:         Provide technical guidance and expertise to the engineering team, ensuring the use of industry best practices and standards.     Prepare teams for reviews and quality assessments of engineering deliverables, ensuring compliance with project requirements, specifications, and quality standards.     Promote continuous improvement initiatives to enhance engineering processes, methodologies, and tools, driving efficiency and productivity.         Stakeholder Collaboration:         Collaborate closely with internal and external stakeholders, including clients, architects, contractors, and regulatory authorities, to ensure project success.     Engage in effective communication, providing regular project updates, addressing concerns, and managing expectations to foster strong client relationships.     Actively participate in meetings, presentations, and technical discussions, representing the engineering team and providing expert insights and recommendations.         Qualifications:         Bachelors or Masters degree in Engineering or a related field with 15+ years of experience in a relevant field. Minimum 5 years of experience leading and co-ordinately multidisciplinary teams.     Ability to obtain relevant professional designation in multiple jurisdictions across Canada.     Strong technical expertise in a relevant engineering discipline, with a deep understanding of engineering principles, methodologies, and best practices.     Demonstrated people management skills, with the ability to unify and motivate team members to achieve project goals.     Exceptional problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality results.     Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex technical information to diverse audiences (both French and English are an asset).     Proven project management skills, including the ability to prioritize tasks, manage resources, and deliver projects within budget and on schedule.     Familiarity with relevant engineering software, tools, and technologies.

column2: We are looking for Project Manager  Key Responsibilities: 1. Project Planning and Coordination: Develop comprehensive project plans, including scope, objectives, timelines, and resource requirements. Coordinate with cross-functional teams, including design, production, procurement, and marketing, to ensure alignment and collaboration throughout the project lifecycle. 2. Risk Management: Identify potential risks and issues that may impact project delivery and develop mitigation strategies to address them. Proactively monitor and manage project risks throughout the project lifecycle to minimize impact on project outcomes. 3. Quality Assurance: Establish and maintain quality assurance processes and standards to ensure project deliverables meet the required quality standards. Conduct regular quality reviews and audits to identify and address any quality issues or discrepancies. 4. Stakeholder Communication: Serve as the primary point of contact for project stakeholders, providing regular updates on project status, progress, and key milestones. Facilitate effective communication and collaboration between project team members, stakeholders, and senior management. 5. Change Management: Manage changes to project scope, objectives, or requirements effectively, ensuring alignment with project goals and objectives. Assess the impact of changes on project delivery and develop strategies to minimize disruption and maintain project momentum. 6. Performance Monitoring and Reporting: Monitor project performance against key metrics, milestones, and deliverables, and provide regular progress reports to stakeholders. Analyze project performance data to identify trends, issues, and areas for improvement, and take corrective action as needed. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Project Management, or related field. Masters degree preferred. Proven experience in project management, preferably in the jewelry or luxury goods industry. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification (not mandatory but in case someone is certified will be a plus point ) Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Excellent organizational and time management abilities, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Solid understanding of project management methodologies, tools, and techniques. Experience working with cross-functional teams and managing stakeholders at all levels. Proficiency in project management software and tools.
column11: Jewellery, Project Management, e-commerce, Quality Assurance, Project Planning, Project Coordination, Risk Management, Performance Monitoring

column2: The Project Manager (PM) position is responsible for ensuring the successful execution and delivery of Agilysys Hospitality Group projects       Agilysys PMs plan, implement, and lead multiple client projects simultaneously     They develop project goals, work plans, timelines, and coordinate resources, implementation strategies and communication     PMs consult customers on Agilysys solutions and use evaluation methods to successfully deliver projects     PMs also collaborate with their peers and management to create best practices and standard operating procedures that will be made available to project owners on other implementation teams     The role requires regular interaction with Sales, Professional Services Management, Product Management, Account Management, Support and Accounting for project planning, execution, and closure              Responsibilities:                    Lead customer facing projects that drive revenue and provide high customer satisfaction.         Develop and manage project plans and documentation based on Agilysys Project Management Group standards.         Identify, manage, report and escalate on program or project risks.         Manage project schedule, budget, resource and quality constraints.         Lead multiple projects by prioritizing and managing conflicts of schedule and resources.         Work with the Managers of Installation Services to help identify and secure resources based on project target dates.         Coordinate with Sales to provide clarity around initially ambiguous projects and process issues.         Work closely with internal resources including installation teams to complete project tasks and address business/technical challenges to meet project goals.         Work directly with customers to set appropriate project expectations, address customer goals, determine target dates, manage customer tasks, provide regular project updates.         Mentor customers in how to best implement the Agilysys solution(s) and provide other Agilysys solution options when possible and applicable.         Provide thought leadership with regards to team and organization challenges.         Collaborate with other internal departments to identify installation improvements and feedback of Agilysys products.         Obtain appropriate training certifications for self-development.         Ensure effective transition of projects to Support.         Other duties as assigned.          Should be working in India night time.               Education and technical requirements:                    Bachelor s degree (in either Project Management, Computer Science, Information Technology, Hospitality Administration and Management, Hotel and Motel Management) and/or 5-7 years experience in Program/Project Management and/or managing technical implementation projects.         Expertise in using MS Project, NetSuite OpenAir, Confluence and MS Office products.         Superior relationship and communication skills (written and verbal).         Ability to lead without authority and drive decision making.         Strong attention to detail, follow through and organization skills to manage multiple concurrent projects.         Ability to persuade, inspire and motivate peers.         Excellent problem solving skills and ability to be flexible to project situations.         Be available to travel up to 20% of the calendar year. Must have or be able to obtain a valid passport for international travel.         Occasional work on weekends and evenings.               Desired Characteristics:                   Customer based Project Management experience in a hourly billable capacity         PMP Certification from Project Management Institute or equivalent certification         Experience developing, installing or supporting hospitality solutions (e.g. point of sale, property management, inventory management systems etc.)         Multilingual skills         Hospitality industry experience

column2: Unilog is looking for a Project Manager (PM), responsible for managing a portfolio of agile projects to deliver B2B Commerce solutions for Unilog s customers. The PM will be required to manage the full lifecycle of projects from requirements to design to development to production go-live and post production support via a cross-functional, highly skilled team. The PM will be adept at delivering projects, both working at a strategic level and rolling up his/her sleeves to get things done whenever needed.       Essential Duties and Responsibilities:         Work with Customers in developing project plans to deliver on-time custom features and functionality.     Work with functional leaders to understand current team capacity for projects to provide reliable estimates to Customers.     Leverage good project management skills to assign tasks to project team members and provide regular check-ins to ensure timelines are met.     Use strong networking skills to build relationships with other managers throughout the organization to ensure your project teams are providing the highest quality deliverables.     Partner your project team with QA to provide feature sign-off and understanding for all developed features.     Be aggressive in getting customers to meet their commitments and timelines to ensure projects stay on track for on-time completion.     Act as a liaison for your projects between all stakeholders and project team members.     Strive to be a product expert and be able to consult with customers about the capabilities of the product.     Ensure all projects follow software development best practices and documentation, ensure coded features meet design requirements, and deliver high-quality work on tight schedules.     Ensure custom features are developed and tested with low defect leakage.     Ensure timely and accurate time reporting is done by all project team members, approve and report on each project to provide transparency     Prepare project plans for your projects, complete with timelines and milestones for all deliverables to provide transparency to the organization and customers.     Manage time off of project team members and use this information for day-to-day task assignments to meet committed estimates and timelines.     Work with functional leaders to manage any day-to-day personnel issues for all of your project team members.     Understand the value your team provides to the organization and ensure a customer first attitude to make your team stand out in a positive way.     Measure your success simply by the success of your projects and be a cheerleader for your project team s accomplishments by communicating them to the organization.     Be an advocate of change, and ensure your project teams have the tools to do their job successfully: software, hardware, direction, clear priorities, and a clear understanding of the overall project.     Be an advocate for the customers and be a voice for them throughout the project lifecycle

column2: A project manager s role is to take on the responsibility for a specific project or several projects within an organization. The Project Manager needs to make sure that a project runs smoothly and stays on schedule and update the progress of their project regularly to the upper management. They are in charge of planning, budgeting, monitoring, and reporting the project with the use of various project management methodologies as well as the processes set in place by Nash Tech Labs.          MANDATORY SKILLS            Good communication and presentation skills.          Ability to express technical and non-technical concepts clearly and concisely.          Good understanding of our services and products, and the ability to facilitate innovation in our concepts, designs, products, and services. Excellent organizational skills to meet predetermined goals and set priorities.          Innate drive to innovate, succeed and be proactive.          Strong organizational talents and ability to work under pressure and in new environments.          Project Manager is expected to have time management skills and comply with the predetermined project plan.          People Management is mandatory for the project manager as he/she will be working together with a group of engineers, directing them on successfully achieving project goals.          Be the architect and design a project which mitigates risk and completes a project as per requirements given by a project manager.            TECHNICAL SKILLS            Experience in hardware design life cycle.          Develops products by studying applicable standards.          Experience in hardware product process flow.            ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES                Feasibility Study:      drive project(s) feasibility study with relevant internal stakeholders and submit a final report to the strategic council.          Initiation finalization of the project proposal must start sequentially after receiving approval from SCB (Strategic Council Board).          Take ownership of Project(s)/product(s) with clear objectives. Questions regarding the feasibility of the execution of a project must be discussed with the management for the final decision.          If you are working on an internal project for NASH, make sure you have enough clarity on the project to execute. In the absence of clarity, please make a note in every meeting to get the required clarity.              Activities Resource Estimation Planning:      Make sure we have the required technical skill availability, the cost target, time target, and resource requirement, before starting execution for internal and/or client project(s).              Define Project SOW      (Statement of work) as per customer requirement, after receiving the confirmation from Customer/Marketing BD. Ensure you have the necessary clarity regarding the conversations with customers and internal meetings recorded and summarized for clear communication with your reporting project team.          Project Manager must plan the execution of sub-modules internally or get it outsourced from the very beginning of the projects or at least after the feasibility test/report.              Identify and create the Project team with the help of all the Functional Managers:      each PM must have a team to execute the project by themselves. No projects must be considered without having enough technical skills and human resources At least 60% of the requirements must be done easily by your team members.          Project Managers will plan the common resource requirements as well (test equipment, test labs, people, others) well in advance. Last-minute requests will be considered based on the availability of resources. Delays in the project will be directly accountable to Project Managers.          Before a project kick-off, it is the project managers responsibility to resolve all relevant and pending queries and uncertainties. Once a project has been initiated, it is the responsibility of the Project Manager to complete the project on time and at the cost target.          Develop a detailed final project plan with milestones that must be vetted by the relevant stakeholders. Ensure the project plan is in line with customer requirements.          Plan the project Kick-off meeting with all Stakeholders once the team is identified.          Submission of the final project proposal with marketing/BD OR the customer.          Project Managers must not accept any changes in the spec, without having clarity on the impact of the changes. If there is a change in spec, it will call for an adjustment in cost and time of the project timeline, it must not be accepted without prior approval by the client and management of Nash Tech Labs.          Managing reports necessary documents as per quality standards QMS requirements: Project Managers are responsible for keeping track of all necessary documents of all the running project(s), each project will have a dedicated folder, which will have the necessary document list.          Ensure System integration is in place for the complete product to make ensure the smooth release of a product you are responsible to remind and follow up with all respective Functional Managers for this critical point till the achievement of a Form-Fit-Function of the final product).          Analyzing Managing project risk (Mitigation plan should be in place): Project Managers must work with Functional Managers/ Lead Engineers of a respective department for the continuous review of the projects technically, if any risks are identified, please address them during your reviews and find and create the mitigation plan.          If the risks cannot be solved or managed, conduct a meeting with the client immediately (Nash Tech Labs management if internal it is a project).          Project Executiocanceled delayed/cancelled if the members are not able to mitigate the risks and come to conclusion on the output or deliverables until a solution is available, and agreeable to all stakeholders.          Managers must report their project in terms of all 10 factors every week: Integration, Scope, Time, Cost, Stakeholders, Procurement, Risk, Communication, Resources, and Quality.          Make and maintain a chart that can explain it all in one small sheet.          Review material tracker as per the BOM and provide feedback to the supply chain management department for timeline improvement wherever required to an inline project plan. Drive to add alternate vendors to add in BOM, wherever there is a single vendor dependency.          Have a track of cost estimation development of the budget, and cost control (Budget Vs Actual). If any additional cost, PM should provide proper justification.          Project Managers are also responsible for the organization motivation of project team(s), monitoring the progress, and providing continuous feedback to stakeholders, as per customer communication.          Project Managers are responsible to highlight the technical training every quarter projects every quarter to the Functional Managers and HR department (only project-specific).          All documents shall be maintained, recorded, and stored for audit at any point in time any phase of the project.          Project Managers are solely responsible for delivering the product(s)/project(s) to the end customer and maintaining cost, time, and intermediate deliverables.          A project manager is required to maintain a database to capture all the courses of action undertaken during a projects life cycle.          Product transfer must be signed-off to the manufacturing facility or customers in case of design services.          Ensure customer satisfaction final approval of product specs during the final stages of the closure of a project.            SOFT SKILLS            Leadership          Communication          Interpersonal Skills          MS-Office          People Management          Time Management          Team Dynamics and Synergy          Delegation of Work          Motivator
column11: Engineering services, Procurement, Aerospace, Project management, Value engineering, Hardware design, Cost estimation, MS Office, Automotive, Monitoring

column2: Are you looking to make a real difference on a global scale,        As a Manager in C-Quest Capital s Carbon and Sustainability Accounting Team (CSAT), you will work with technical teams through all aspects of carbon and sustainability accounting and compliance management        You will have the opportunity to drive transformational and sustainable strategies, contributing to successful project implementation across various regions in a truly global multicultural workplace          The Carbon and Sustainability Accounting Team (CSAT),        is responsible for all aspects of carbon and sustainability accounting and compliance management for CQC s growing portfolio of projects, which currently number more than 90 projects and growing.          CQC is active in a number of different carbon verticals in both reductions and avoidance including household devices, fuel switching, industrial energy efficiency, renewable energy, avoided methane emissions and methane capture and use, as well as nature-based carbon credits, including, but not limited to those associated with bamboo afforestation, restoration forestry, farmer managed natural restoration, assisted natural restoration, other forms of regenerative agriculture and sustainable forestry management and soil carbon accumulation.                Key Responsibilities:                            Co-manage technical teams of the GHG crediting programs for processing of projects through validation and verification, specifically for Sustainable Development Verified Impact Standard (SD VISta) program.              Provide technical support in project conceptualization, planning, implementation and monitoring to adhere to the guidelines outlined under the GHG crediting program, specifically SD VISta              Advise in determining the sustainable development related benefits achievable from different project activities under other programs like Voluntary Carbon Standard (VCS), Gold Standard (GS) etc              Play a key role in ensuring the quality of documents in various stages of validation and verification, including reviewing project documentation, analyzing survey results, etc              Provide guidance and trainings during baseline data collection, data analysis, validation, and verification activities etc              Assist in planning and development of data collection tools such as developing questionnaires designed to understand baseline scenarios and monitoring project activities in different countries              Provide technical training to the on-field team members at regular intervals, to ensure smooth functioning of the project.              Provide regular trainings to CSAT team members regarding latest guidelines, tools, methodologies, etc to enable constant up-skilling of the team.                The successful candidate must have experience working in a carbon/ climate change domain.                  Prior experience would include:                        Minimum 5 years of relevant working experience in a fast-paced environment with a matrix organization structure.              Demonstrated management experience of teams of 5+ members.              In-depth understanding of the concept of sustainable development and attributes associated with the sustainable development goals              In-depth understanding of various GHG crediting programs such as the Clean Development Mechanism (CDM), Verified Carbon Standard (VCS), SD VISta, Gold Standard, Article 6.              Experience in carbon project methodology development is preferred.              Strong knowledge of sampling approaches for household energy efficiency projects.              Working experience with a multi-country/multi-cultural team and/or with developmental agencies.              A bachelor s degree in the field of science, environment, statistics, energy, economics, engineering, or similar field is required              A master s degree/ PHD in the field of energy and/or environment, engineering is preferred.                        Key Skills/Abilities:                    Excellent team building skills with adaptability to work in culturally diverse environment              Project management and organizational and progress tracking skills, including the ability to prioritize and deliver efficiently and effectively under deadlines.              Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills. Able to clearly and concisely articulate their communications when interacting with a wide range of stakeholders across various levels including Heads of Departments across CQC.              Ability to work with teams spread across different locations in India, Africa, Southeast Asia.              A good understanding of the challenges that climate change presents and the role that carbon markets can play to address it.              A passion to actively help the rural poor in less developed countries in line with the UN Sustainable Development Goals.              Good numerate skills.              An ability to fit in with the high-performance and collaborative culture of CQC.              An ability to self-manage day to day activities.                        Travel    :        The expectation is that the Manager will have occasional travel to meet with colleagues and partners in the operating regions, but most of the time this role will be Delhi-based.

column1: Mission Manager - River Basin Conservation Project
column2: This large-scale river basin conservation project in Maharashtra is spearheaded by CSRBOX, a leading corporate social responsibility (CSR) Practice organization in India. The project aims to drive a collaborative platform and program to address the critical challenges of river basin health and promote sustainable water management practices.           About the Role:           We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Mission Manager to play a pivotal role in the success of this ambitious project. As the Mission Manager, you will be responsible for leading and managing all aspects of the project, from program development and implementation to stakeholder engagement and advocacy. You will be acting as the CEO of the Mission and drive the Project with support of a fully equipped Secretariate with teams in project management, communications and technical domain expertise.     Responsibilities            Develop and implement a comprehensive program: Lead the development and execution of a strategic program for river basin conservation, aligned with the projects objectives and donor requirements.         Drive collaborative platform: Establish and manage a collaborative platform that brings together diverse stakeholders, including government agencies, municipalities, NGOs, private sector companies, and communities, to work towards shared goals.         Stakeholder engagement and advocacy: Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including government officials, industry leaders, and community representatives. Advocate for policies and regulations that support sustainable river basin management.         Lead a multidisciplinary team: Provide effective leadership and guidance to a team of communication specialists, technical experts, and other project staff.         Communication and outreach: Develop and implement a comprehensive communication strategy to raise awareness about the projects goals and achievements. Manage media relations and public outreach activities.         Monitoring and evaluation: Track the progress of the project against set targets and indicators. Prepare regular reports for donors and stakeholders.       Mandatory Qualification and Experience:            Masters degree in environmental science, natural resource management or allied areas, Doctorate is preferred.         Minimum 10 years of experience working on environmental projects, with a strong focus on projects on water conservation, natural resource management         Proven experience in program development, implementation, and management.         Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills.         Ability to build strong relationships with diverse stakeholders at all levels.         Experience in advocacy and public policy work is desirable.         Strong leadership and team management skills.         Excellent written and verbal communication skills.         Fluency in English and Hindi is mandatory. Knowledge of Marathi is a plus.

column2: A Project Manager is responsible for the planning, execution, and closing of projects, ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the satisfaction of stakeholders.     Project planning: Developing project schedules, timelines, budgets, and resource plans, and working with project team members and stakeholders to define project objectives and requirements.     Communication and coordination: Maintaining regular communication with project stakeholders, ensuring that project information is accurate and up-to-date, and coordinating the flow of information between project team members and stakeholders.     Task management: Managing project tasks, including tracking progress, identifying risks, and escalating issues to stakeholders. Documentation: Maintaining project documentation, including project plans, status reports, and project artifacts.     Financial management: Managing project financials, including tracking project expenses, preparing budgets, and generating financial reports.      Risk management: Assisting with risk management, including identifying and assessing project risks, developing mitigation plans, and tracking risk mitigation progress.     Stakeholder management: Building and maintaining positive relationships with project stakeholders, ensuring that project requirements are understood and met, and providing regular project updates.     Leadership: Leading and motivating project teams, delegating tasks and responsibilities, and providing guidance and support to team members.     Quality control: Ensuring that project deliverables meet quality standards and implementing quality control processes and procedures     Closure: Ensuring that projects are closed out in a timely and efficient manner and conducting post-project evaluations to identify areas for improvement.     The ideal candidate for the Project Manager role should have strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills, an ability to work well under pressure, and a proven track record of delivering projects on time and within budget.     They should also be comfortable using project management tools and software and have a strong understanding of project management methodologies.     At least 2 years of ecommerce industry experience is must technical background for a couple of years is highly preferrable     Any certification (eg, PMP, CSM, or any) in project management would be an added advantage.         Schedule:    Monday to Friday     Opening(s):    1
column11: PMP, Quality standards, Project management, Financial management, Project planning, Manager Quality Control, Budgeting, Risk management, Stakeholder management, Risk mitigation
