column2: The portfolio of capital projects under each sector will be managed by the Sector Portfolio Management Team (lead by the Sector Capital Projects Director) with each site having a small team to manage the execution of capital projects up the value of 10m through a third party.      Each site will take ownership of the delivery of capital projects and manage the third party to ensure that projects are delivered safely, on time and to budget.      The role of Site Engineering & Projects Manager is a key part of the onsite project management team who will liaise with the third party on behalf of Johnson Matthey to guide and support within the remit of their role.      The scope of the role will vary depending on the size of the sector and sites. It is therefore possible that the Site Project Manager could be managing one larger site, or a portfolio of smaller sites and will be deputised by a Site Project Engineer, a role which will be present at each site.      The role of the Site Project Manager is to take a holistic view on the delivery of projects with the key accountability of managing the contract, with the day to day activities undertake by the Site Project Engineer and site project management team.          Principal accountabilities    Principal accountabilities for this role are:          To manage the capital projects process from idea to handover.          Manage the term services contractor working on site          Ensure project risks are managed and escalated and cost and timings are met.          Manage the interaction with Group Capital Projects and Sector Projects and ensure applicable standards are implemented.          Build and continuously improve project management capability, which includes all elements of the governance, process, reporting KPI, system and competence development          To work with the leadership team to assist in prioritising project selection, and to ensure effective transition between project completion and assimilation of new assets to BAU.          To forecast the resource requirements for the Capital Projects teams to ensure that the functional leads can provide the right number of resources and the right skill sets as required.          Ensure completion and handover of projects to the clients satisfaction. Conduct post project reviews to identify areas for improvement.        To act as the focal point for project initiation      Organisational structure    The Site Project Manager sits within the Site Project Management Team and dotted lines to the Sector Capital Projects Director.        Scope            This role is required to support either a singular site or a portfolio of small sites. However, there may be instances when wider support from the job holder is required          Working relationships of the job holder will range from project personnel, contractors, consultants, wider JM staff and senior management as necessary to discharge their duties.          Plant focus          Capex budget, direct and indirect reports plant specific                Special factors            This role will be primarily based upon one site. However, there may be international or domestic travel required as is seen fit.                    Person specification          Qualifications/ knowledge/ experience          Degree educated (BSc/MSc in Chemical or Mechanical Engineering or Business Management studies)      Essential              International Project Management Association (IPMA) Level C or Association of Project Management (APM) PMQ qualification, or prepared and capable to work towards      Essential              Significant experience working on (or managing) large scale capital projects in either an oil and gas, FMCG, chemicals or pharmaceutical industry (or) significant experience of working in project or programme management environment, with responsibility for delivery or controls of individual projects, programmes or portfolios.      Essential              Demonstratable experience at applying organisational or recognised project management policies, frameworks, methodologies and standards.      Essential              Experience in managing major contractors through engineering, procurement, construction and handover stages or prepared to learn and work towards      Essential              Experience working with third party contractors to deliver projects      Desirable              Demonstratable examples of a stringent attitude to working safely in design and operation      Essential              Ability to adapt to new ways of working      Desirable              Delivery focused & self starter. Determined to take action to achieve goals within business critical timescales and work under pressure      Desirable              Confidence to question, challenge, and escalate issues as appropriate      Desirable              Ability to manage multiple stakeholders and competing demands      Desirable              Able to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences      Desirable              Ability to work outside the immediate team silo and building partnerships with the wider organisation      Desirable              Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate with all levels and produce clear, concise documents to high standard.      Desirable              Proficiency in working with Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Project, MS project and Visio)      Essential

Provide strategic inputs to the implementation of OVC components as per the specific need of the implementation sites in the district in close-coordination with ART Centres and VIHAAN team.                Manage a team of Child Care Facilitators (CCF) who provide services both at ART centres and in the community. The CCF are expected to introduce beneficiaries to the OVC activities to the parents of CLHIV, children of PLHIV and adolescents of key population. The CCF are expected to conduct registration and needs assessment of beneficiaries while enrolling into the program. The CCF will provide nutrition monitoring, linkages to health/NCD screening, support linkages with existing health/nutrition/social benefits, leverage donor/CSR support to implement various activities, ensure treatment adherence and viral load monitoring support.                Provide technical inputs to ensure there is no duplication of services in terms of geography or target population in close coordination with ART centres and DAPCUs. Provide mentoring and supervisory support to the field staff and external consultants engaged for the component.                Coordinate with TI NGO, facility and community-based efforts to implement the project components.                Maintain the timelines for OVC project implementation, adhere to the project guidelines, fulfil the project targets, prepare any reports as necessary & maintain the deliverables                Provide training and capacity building support to OVC staff especially in terms of HIV/AIDS, communication skills, and lay counselling on health, nutrition, education, and sustainable livelihoods. Also coordinate with officials of National Health Mission, ICDS, Social Welfare departments to ensure that the services are linked for OVC beneficiaries.                Identify and establish linkages with National Adolescent Health Programs to improve access of services for the Adolescents. Consider formation of atleast two adolescent forums at mandal level to encourage their participation in the design and implementation.                Liaise with all relevant stakeholders in the district and state as necessary to leverage services for beneficiaries as mentioned above, including but not limited to SACS, DAPCU, VIHAAN, National Health Mission, Social Welfare Departments, National Adolescent Health Programs and other private stakeholders                Work closely with the DAPCU to ensure that the HIV testing, HIV treatment initiation, Viral load monitoring to the eligible CLHIV. Complement the ongoing services implemented by SACS and other agencies.                Prepare a district specific action plan ensuring that there is no duplication of services under OVC component. Monitor the progress and update the District and State teams.                Review program data on a routine basis to ensure acceptability and availability of services for target beneficiaries. column2: Job Profile: ?Project Manager - Electrical & Instrumentation Job Title: ?Project Manager - Electrical & Instrumentation Location: Delhi Company : EPS Instrumentation Pvt Ltd Job Type: Full-Time Reports To: Director Job Summary: The Project Manager for Electrical & Instrumentation will oversee the planning, execution, and completion of electrical and instrumentation projects. This role requires a strong technical background in electrical engineering and substantial project management experience. The ideal candidate will possess a B.Tech in Electrical Engineering and have at least 10 years of relevant experience. Key Responsibilities: Project Planning and Management: Develop comprehensive project plans that cover all necessary aspects such as scope, resources, timeline, budget, and risks. Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure project milestones are achieved on time and within budget. Implement and maintain project management standards and processes. Technical Oversight: Provide technical guidance and support to the project team. Ensure all electrical and instrumentation work complies with industry standards, codes, and regulations. Review and approve technical designs, drawings, and specifications. Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of engineers, technicians, and subcontractors. Facilitate effective communication among project stakeholders, including clients, team members, and senior management. Conduct regular team meetings to monitor progress and address any issues. Quality Assurance: Establish and enforce quality control processes to ensure the highest standards of workmanship. Conduct regular inspections and audits to ensure compliance with project requirements and industry standards. Risk Management: Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies. Monitor and manage project risks to minimize impact on project outcomes. Ensure all safety protocols are adhered to on site. Budget Management: Develop and manage project budgets. Monitor project expenses and ensure financial targets are met. Prepare and present regular financial reports to senior management. Client Relations: Maintain strong relationships with clients to understand their needs and expectations. Provide regular project updates to clients and address any concerns promptly. Ensure client satisfaction by delivering high-quality projects on time and within budget. Qualifications and Skills: Education: Bachelors degree (B.Tech) in Electrical Engineering is mandatory. Experience: Minimum 10 years of experience in managing electrical and instrumentation projects. Proven track record of successfully delivering large-scale projects. Technical Skills: Extensive knowledge of electrical systems, instrumentation, and control systems. Proficient in project management software and tools. Familiarity with industry standards and regulations. Project Management Skills: Strong project planning, execution, and monitoring capabilities. Excellent risk management and problem-solving skills. Ability to manage budgets and financial aspects of projects. Leadership and Interpersonal Skills: Exceptional leadership and team management abilities. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams. Certifications: PMP (Project Management Professional) or equivalent certification is preferred but not mandatory. Working Conditions: This position may require occasional travel to project sites. Must be able to work in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment. Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends if necessary.

column2: As an IT Project Manager, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing and managing various IT projects, ensuring their successful execution from conception to completion. You will lead a team of at least four individuals, guiding them through project milestones and ensuring deliverables meet quality standards and client expectations.                  *Key Responsibilities:*          1. *Project Leadership:* Lead and manage IT projects, including software application development, web development, ERPs, CRMs, and other IT solutions.          2. *Team Management:* Supervise and mentor a team of at least four individuals, providing guidance, support, and motivation to ensure optimal performance and collaboration.          3. *Client Relationship Management:* Source leads and clients from IT business development managers (ITBDM) and establish strong relationships with clients. Act as the primary point of contact for clients, addressing their needs, concerns, and requirements throughout the project lifecycle.          4. *Project Execution:* Take ownership of project execution, from initial planning and scoping to implementation and delivery. Ensure projects are completed within budget, on schedule, and in adherence to quality standards.          5. *Risk Management:* Identify and mitigate project risks, proactively addressing issues that may impact project timelines or deliverables. Implement effective risk management strategies to ensure project success.          6. *Communication:* Maintain clear and open communication channels with team members, clients, and stakeholders, providing regular updates on project progress, milestones, and any relevant developments.                  *Requirements:*          - Minimum of 3 years of experience in project management within the IT sector, with a proven track record of successfully managing IT projects.          - Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to lead and motivate a team towards project goals.          - Excellent client-facing and communication abilities, with the capacity to build and maintain strong client relationships.          - Proficiency in project management methodologies and tools, with the ability to effectively plan, execute, and monitor project activities.          - Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field is preferred.          - PMP or PRINCE2 certification is a plus.
column11: PMP, Quality standards, Team management, Project management, Web development, IT projects, Application development, Risk management, Information technology

column2: Position Overview:    As a Project Manager in the Healthcare Industry, you will play a crucial role in planning, executing, and overseeing various projects aimed at improving healthcare processes, systems, and services. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including medical professionals, administrators, IT specialists, and other stakeholders to ensure the successful delivery of projects that contribute to enhancing patient care, operational efficiency, and overall healthcare quality.       Key Responsibilities:         Project Planning and Initiation:         Collaborate with stakeholders to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables.         Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, resource allocation, and budget estimates.         Conduct feasibility studies and risk assessments to identify potential challenges and develop mitigation strategies.         Team Coordination and Leadership:         Assemble and lead multidisciplinary project teams, ensuring clear communication of roles and responsibilities.         Foster a collaborative and productive team environment, motivating team members to achieve project goals.         Provide guidance, direction, and support to team members throughout project lifecycles.         Project Execution and Monitoring:         Implement project plans, monitor progress, and ensure adherence to timelines and milestones.         Regularly track project metrics, identify deviations, and implement corrective actions as needed.         Manage project risks and issues, escalating critical concerns to senior management when necessary.         Stakeholder Engagement:         Communicate effectively with stakeholders, ensuring alignment on project objectives, progress, and outcomes.         Conduct regular status meetings, presentations, and reports to keep stakeholders informed and engaged.         Address stakeholder feedback and concerns, adjusting project plans as required.         Quality Assurance and Documentation:         Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including project charters, plans, status reports, and change requests.         Ensure adherence to industry standards, regulatory requirements, and best practices in healthcare project management.         Conduct thorough quality reviews to validate project deliverables and ensure they meet established standards.         Budget and Resource Management:         Monitor project budgets, expenses, and resource utilization to ensure projects are delivered within allocated financial constraints.         Collaborate with finance and procurement teams to procure necessary resources and manage vendor relationships.         Continuous Improvement:         Identify opportunities for process improvement and operational efficiencies within healthcare projects.         Foster a culture of continuous learning and professional development within the project team.         Qualifications and Requirements:         Bachelor s degree in a relevant field (Healthcare Management, Business Administration, Project Management, etc.). Master s degree preferred.         Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or equivalent is highly desirable.         Proven experience (X+ years) in successfully managing healthcare projects from initiation to completion.         In-depth knowledge of healthcare industry processes, regulations, and best practices.         Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.         Proficiency in project management tools and software.         Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities.         Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work well under pressure.
column11: PMP, Process improvement, Resource allocation, healthcare management, Healthcare, Project planning, Resource management, Continuous improvement, Operations, Monitoring

column2: This position is Pune, India based and in-office (at least 3 days a week);              Ideally you are located near our world class office and are both tech-savvy and experienced working as an internal consultant       Experience in a technology-driven company, business analytics platform, the payments space, or the airline vertical is a definite plus                      How You Will Make an Impact:                   Channel your focus on Project Management, Business Analytics, and KPIs         Manage Business Alignment and technology focused related projects to successful completion         Work with other cross-functional teams to align processes with core technology and delivery processes         Become a CellPoint Digital ambassador within the industry and internal team         Analyze and produce statistics and management reports for the leadership and product team                   Skills you will have fine-tuned:                   Hands-on experience (3-7 years), including experience with databases and BI Tools         Some understanding of the eCommerce payment ecosystem and various roles/players (Payment Service Providers, payment schemes, etc)         Understanding of the travel and/or airline space a big plus         Excellent communication skills whereby fluent English (written and oral) is a must         Deep knowledge of BI solutions/theory/administration          Experience working in and around software development teams         Ability to manage multiple, mid-sized projects simultaneously         SQL and report writing knowledge         You are eager to bring your unique talents and authenticity to the CellPoint Digital community         You're constantly curious and a lifetime learner         You have excellent communication and relationship-building skills         You enjoy leading and/or supporting cross-functional initiatives and projects in a team where you are empowered and accountable         You thrive in a fast-paced environment and the challenge of managing multiple projects simultaneously while prioritizing high-return work         You approach challenges with a solution-oriented mindset         You are able to thrive in a distributed organization across multiple time zones               Whats in it for you:                   We offer you the opportunity to be an innovator, challenge the status quo, and redefine the payments category         Competitive salary in a fast-growing start-up         Medical insurance with coverage for dependents (parents, spouse, children)         Rewards and recognition program         Flexible hybrid work model; were a fully distributed company, and we provide the tools, culture, and support to make your work setup work for you
